KOR 101.courseDesc: Introductory Korean. Includes listening, speaking and writing, with individual audio-video practice.

KOR 102.courseDesc: Introductory Korean. Includes listening, speaking and writing, with individual audio-video practice. Builds on Korean 101.

KOR 103.courseDesc: Introductory Korean. Includes listening, speaking and writing, with individual audio-video practice. Builds on Korean 102.

KOR 201.courseDesc: This course includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing practice, with a focus on cultural competency and conversational skills. Builds onKOR 103.

KOR 202.courseDesc: This course includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing practice, with a focus on cultural competency and conversational skills. Builds onKOR 201.

KOR 310.courseDesc: Provides advanced practice in written and oral communication, including journalistic, professional, and creative writing. Examines contemporary cultural contexts through media and news. Taught in Korean.

KOR 320.fullName: Introduction to Language for the Professions
KOR 320.courseDesc: Introduction to communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. Taught in Korean.
KOR 320.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

KOR 350.fullName: Introduction to Language, Media, and Society
KOR 350.courseDesc: Introduction to the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. Taught in Korean.
KOR 350.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

KOR 410.courseDesc: Provides advanced grammar instruction and fosters translation and communication skills within a contemporary cultural context. Taught in Korean.
KOR 410.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

KOR 420.fullName: Advanced Studies in Language for the Professions
KOR 420.courseDesc: Advanced communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. Taught in Korean.
KOR 420.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

KOR 450.fullName: Advanced Topics in Language, Media, and Society
KOR 450.courseDesc: Advanced analysis of the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. Taught in Korean. Topics will vary according to the instructor's expertise.
KOR 450.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

KOR I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
KOR I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
